intro: Rubus langankianus, commonly known as the Langkian blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within the Rubus genus.
